title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected today
byline: The Intertropical Convergence Zone, where winds from the Northern Hemisphere and Southern Hemisphere converge, is affecting the island’s weather, the Department of Meteorology says.

title: Sri Lanka hosts tourism roadshow in Saudi Arabia after a decade
byline: Sri Lanka tourism promotion roadshow was recently held in Saudi Arabia’ Eastern Province with the participation of a large number of Destination Management Companies, after a ten-year hiatus.

title: Investigations launched into Rs. 2.7 bn loss from Lanka Phosphate export deal
byline: Investigations have been launched into a controversial deal involving the Lanka Phosphate Company, which allegedly sold 3,000 metric tons of rock phosphate to three companies for export during the tenure of the previous government, resulting in a loss of Rs. 2,700 million to the state.

title: Pakistan’s minister Tarar warns of possible Indian military strike within 24-36 hours
byline: Pakistan’s information minister Attaullah Tarar said on Wednesday that the country has credible intelligence that India intends to launch a military strike within the next 24 to 36 hours.

title: Four arrested with 322kg Kerala cannabis in Northern seas
byline: Four persons have been taken into custody for the possession of Kerala cannabis in the sea area off Valvettithurai by the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: 15 May Day events and rallies to be held in Colombo tomorrow
byline: At least 15 May Day processions, commemorative events and rallies are scheduled to be held in Colombo tomorrow (May 1), Sri Lanka Police confirmed.

title: 2025 LG Polls: 33 candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: A total of 33 candidates contesting at the upcoming Local Government (LG) election have been arrested for flouting election laws, Police have announced.

title: Google launches AI tools for practicing languages through personalized lessons
byline: Google on Tuesday is releasing three new AI experiments aimed at helping people learn to speak a new language in a more personalized way. While the experiments are still in the early stages, it’s possible that the company is looking to take on Duolingo with the help of Gemini, Google’s multimodal large language model.

title: Motor Traffic Dept. closed on 5 and 6 May
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) announced that its offices will remain closed on 5 and 6 of May.

title: Navy steps up to restore Kandy Lake following “Siri Dalada Wandanawa”
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy, in collaboration with the Clean Sri Lanka Secretariat, has undertaken post-event maintenance efforts at the historic Kandy Lake following the special “Siri Dalada Wandanawa” exposition.

title: Two arrested over Rs. 77 million fraud at Sabaragamuwa PC remanded
byline: A female Assistant Director of the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council and a former Secretary of a Ministry under the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council, who were arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with a fraud of Rs. 77 million have been remanded until 8 May.

title: Nepal announces major rule change for anyone who wants to climb Everest
byline: Nepal is set to pass a law to grant permits to climb Mount Everest only to those who have previously scaled at least one 7,000-metre peak within the country, marking a major shift for the tourism-dependent country amid concerns over overcrowding and ecological imbalance on the world’s highest mountain.

title: Sri Lanka, Pakistan hold talks on defence collaboration
byline: A high-level discussion has taken place between Sri Lanka and Pakistan aimed at enhancing bilateral cooperation, fostering mutual understanding on regional security dynamics and exploring opportunities for defence collaboration, the Ministry of Defence said.

title: Trump celebrates 100 days in office by touting record and blasting foes
byline: US President Donald Trump has celebrated the 100th day of his second term in office with a campaign-style speech, touting his achievements and targeting political foes.

title: Two Australian women injured in Haputale accident
byline: Two foreign nationals have been hospitalized following a road accident that occurred near the Asokaramaya Temple along the Haputale–Welimada road in Haputale.

title: Welikada custodial death: Court sets May 16 for evidence examination
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today ordered that evidence be examined on May 16 in the magisterial inquiry into the death of a 25-year-old youth who died while in police custody following his arrest by the Welikada Police.

title: Notice for voters regarding official polling cards for 2025 LG Election
byline: The Department of Posts has issued a special notice for those who are still to receive their official polling cards for the 2025 Local Government (LG) election.

title: WhatsApp will stop working on select iPhones from next month
byline: WhatsApp users with older iPhones will soon find themselves unable to access the messaging platform, as the company prepares to withdraw support for select devices starting next month.

title: Central Bank generates over Rs. 274 bln profit in 2024
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reported a profit of Rs. 274.79 billion for the year 2024, according to its latest financial disclosures.

title: Dy Finance Minister hints Sri Lanka may opt to purchase more energy products from US
byline: Sri Lanka has made significant progress in discussions with United States trade authorities and the International Monetary Fund (IMF), with both engagements yielding positive outcomes, according to Deputy Minister of Finance Harshana Suriyapperuma.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Boossa Prison Jailor granted bail
byline: The Jailor at the Boossa Prison, who was remanded in connection with the shooting and killing of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” inside the Colombo Magistrate’s Court complex, has been granted bail.

title: EU to ‘positively consider’ extending GSP+ concession to Sri Lanka
byline: The Head of the South Asia Division of the European Union (EU), Charles Whiteley has said the European Union would positively consider extending the GSP+ trade concession to Sri Lanka in its review, the President’s Media Division said.

title: Court to hear petition by NOC Secretary General against suspension
byline: The Court of Appeal today (30) scheduled the hearing of the petition filed by Maxwell de Silva, who served as the Secretary of the National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOC), requesting an order to invalidate the decision made to suspend him from the position.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink gets approval to operate in Bangladesh
byline: Starlink Services Bangladesh Limited has been granted the go-ahead to begin operations in the country, with two licences issued by the Bangladesh Telecommunication Regulatory Commission (BTRC).

title: Hotel fire in India’s Kolkata kills 14
byline: At least 14 people, including two children, died in the eastern Indian city of Kolkata late on Tuesday when a fire blazed through a six-storey hotel in a congested neighbourhood, authorities said.

title: Colombo’s inflation climbs in April
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to -2.0% in April 2025, compared to -2.6% in March 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Task Force to combat Chikungunya and Dengue in Western Province
byline: A preliminary discussion on an action plan to eradicate the rapidly spreading dengue cases and Chikungunya virus infections, which are rapidly spreading across Sri Lanka, was held today (30) at the Western Province Governor’s Office.

title: Liquor shops in several areas closed tomorrow
byline: Retail liquor sales outlets functioning within divisional secretariat areas where May Day events are being organized will remain closed tomorrow (1 May), the Excise Department has announced.

title: Govt. keen on favorable outcome before 90-day pause on Trump tariffs ends
byline: The Sri Lankan government is confident of arriving at a favorable outcome regarding the reciprocal tariffs imposed by United States President Donald Trump, before the lapse of the temporary 90-day suspension on its enforcement, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Sooriyapperuma has stated.

title: Ex-Policewoman remanded over Rs 30 mln asset fraud
byline: A retired Woman Police Sergeant has been arrested by the Criminal & Financial Crime Investigation Department for allegedly acquiring assets valued at around Rs. 30 million using forged documents.

title: Trains delayed due to derailment between Fort and Maradana
byline: A train has derailed between the Colombo Fort and Maradana railway stations causing severe delays to services.

title: Second day of ‘Batalanda’ Commission report debate to be decided on Friday
byline: The Committee on Parliamentary Business is scheduled to meet on Friday (02 May).

title: Over 1,400 Indians leave Pakistan while 786 Pakistanis exit India in six days
byline: A total of 1,465 Indian nationals, including 25 diplomats and officials, have crossed over to India from Pakistan through the international border crossing located in Punjab since April 24, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Laugfs Gas says no price revision in May
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC, one of the two largest liquefied petroleum (LP) gas suppliers in the country, announced that the company will not revise domestic LP gas prices for the month of May 2025.

title: ‘Clean Sri Lanka’ to launch 1,000-acre forest plantation project
byline: Under the “Clean Sri Lanka” programme, plans are underway to launch a 1,000-acre forest plantation project in collaboration with the private sector, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Fuel prices reduced
byline: Ceypetco fuel prices will be reduced from midnight today (30), the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) announced.

title: Father of one sentenced to life in prison for heroin possession
byline: A 38-year-old father of one was sentenced to life imprisonment by the Colombo High Court today (30) after being found guilty for the possession and trafficking of 2 grams and 29 milligrams of heroin.

title: Trump says ‘be patient’ as US economy contracts on tariff disruption
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Americans should be patient in the face of a first quarter economic contraction, arguing that his tariffs would eventually lead to a boom in the U.S. economy.
